This would result in fewer hospitalizations, medical procedures, and follow-up care, thus reducing the cost of healthcare.
The number of people living with disabilities or compromised immune systems would decrease, leading to an increase in overall quality of life.
This improvement in health would likely result in a higher life expectancy for individuals and the population as a whole.
The increased productivity and reduced healthcare-related expenses would likely boost economic growth and overall wellbeing.
All of these results would contribute to more social and economic equality as healthcare access and disparities in healthcare outcomes would be significantly reduced.
